Step 1: Gather Tools and Safety Equipment
- Tools needed: Phillips head screwdriver, flat head screwdriver, measuring tape, hammer, and a level.
- Safety equipment: Safety goggles, work gloves, and a dust mask.

Step 2: Identify and Lay Out Parts
- Unpack all the wooden pieces and screws from the packaging.
- Identify each piece according to the instruction manual. Typically, there will be shelves, side panels, a top panel, a bottom panel, and a back panel.
- Lay out all the pieces on a flat surface in an organized manner.

Step 3: Verify Package Contents
- Compare the parts and screws with the parts list provided in the manual to ensure everything is present.
- If any parts are missing, contact the manufacturer for replacements before proceeding.

Step 4: Assemble Side Panels
- Attach the side panels to the bottom panel using the provided screws. Align the pre-drilled holes on the panels and insert screws through them.
- Tighten the screws using a Phillips head screwdriver.

Step 5: Attach Shelves
- Position the shelves between the side panels. Ensure they are level and aligned with the pre-drilled holes on the side panels.
- Insert screws through the side panels into the shelves and tighten them with a screwdriver.

Step 6: Attach Top Panel
- Place the top panel onto the assembled side panels and shelves.
- Align the pre-drilled holes and secure the top panel with screws using a Phillips head screwdriver.

Step 7: Secure Back Panel
- Lay the bookshelf face down on a flat surface.
- Position the back panel onto the rear of the bookshelf. Ensure it is square and aligned with the edges.
- Attach the back panel using the provided screws or nails. If nails are provided, use a hammer to secure them.

Step 8: Check for Stability
- Stand the bookshelf upright and check for stability. Ensure all screws are tightened and the bookshelf does not wobble.
- Use a level to check that the shelves are horizontally aligned. Adjust if necessary.

Step 9: Troubleshooting
- If the bookshelf is unstable, double-check that all screws are fully tightened and that the back panel is securely attached.
- If shelves are not level, loosen the screws, adjust the shelves, and retighten.

Step 10: Finishing Touches
- Wipe down the bookshelf to remove any dust or debris.
- If desired, apply furniture pads to the bottom of the bookshelf to protect the floor.

Step 11: Safety Check
- Ensure the bookshelf is placed on a stable, even surface.
- If the bookshelf is tall, consider securing it to the wall using anti-tip brackets for added safety, especially if you have children or pets.

Step 12: Enjoy Your Bookshelf
- Allow the bookshelf to sit for a few hours to ensure all parts are securely in place.
- Start organizing your books and decorations on your new bookshelf.

Following these steps will help ensure that you assemble your bookshelf safely and efficiently.

Step 1: Gather Tools and Materials
- Identify and gather all the pre-cut wooden pieces, screws, and any additional parts included in the bookshelf kit.
- Collect the necessary tools: a Phillips head screwdriver, a flathead screwdriver, a hammer, a measuring tape, and an electric drill (optional for faster assembly).
- Ensure you have protective gear: safety glasses, work gloves, and possibly knee pads if you will be working on the floor.

Step 2: Identify and Organize Parts
- Lay out all the wooden pieces and screws on a flat, clean surface. 
- Refer to the assembly manual (if provided) to identify each part. Typically, parts will include side panels, shelves, a top panel, a bottom panel, a back panel, and various screws or fasteners.
- Group similar parts together to make the assembly process smoother.

Step 3: Review Safety Precautions
- Wear safety glasses to protect your eyes from dust and debris.
- Use work gloves to prevent splinters and protect your hands from sharp edges.
- Ensure the workspace is well-lit and free from obstructions to avoid accidents.

Step 4: Assemble the Frame
- Begin by attaching the bottom panel to one of the side panels. Align the pre-drilled holes and insert screws. Use a Phillips head screwdriver to tighten the screws securely.
- Repeat the process for the other side panel, attaching it to the bottom panel to form a U-shape.

Step 5: Attach the Top Panel
- Place the top panel on top of the side panels, aligning the pre-drilled holes.
- Insert screws into the aligned holes and tighten them using the Phillips head screwdriver. Ensure the top panel is securely fastened and level.

Step 6: Install the Shelves
- Position each shelf at the desired height within the frame. Most kits will have multiple pre-drilled holes to allow for adjustable shelf heights.
- Insert the shelf support pegs into the corresponding holes on the side panels. Place the shelves on top of the support pegs.
- For added stability, some kits may require you to screw the shelves into place. If so, align the shelves with the pre-drilled holes and secure them with screws.

Step 7: Attach the Back Panel
- Align the back panel with the frame. The back panel will typically add structural support and prevent the bookshelf from wobbling.
- Use a hammer and nails, or screws and a screwdriver, to attach the back panel to the frame. Ensure it is flush with the edges of the side, top, and bottom panels.

Step 8: Final Adjustments and Inspection
- Check that all screws and fasteners are tight and secure. Use the flathead screwdriver to tighten any that may be loose.
- Ensure the bookshelf is level and stable. Use a measuring tape or level tool to make any necessary adjustments.
- Wipe down the bookshelf with a clean cloth to remove any dust or debris from the assembly process.

Step 9: Troubleshooting Tips
- If a screw won't tighten properly, ensure it is aligned correctly with the pre-drilled hole. If the hole is stripped, use a slightly larger screw or a wood filler to secure it.
- If the bookshelf wobbles, double-check that the back panel is securely attached and that all screws are tightened equally.
- For any missing parts or unclear instructions, refer to the manufacturer's customer support for assistance.

Step 10: Clean Up and Enjoy
- Clean up your workspace, putting away tools and disposing of any packaging materials.
- Place the bookshelf in your desired location and begin organizing your books and items.
- Enjoy your newly assembled bookshelf!

Step 1: Gather Ingredients and Equipment
- Ingredients: 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, 2 cups granulated sugar, 3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp salt, 2 large eggs, 1 cup whole milk, 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup boiling water.
- Equipment: 2 9-inch round cake pans, parchment paper, mixing bowls, sifter, whisk, electric mixer, measuring cups and spoons, rubber spatula, cooling rack, serrated knife, offset spatula.

Step 2: Preheat Oven and Prepare Pans
- Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
- Grease the cake pans with butter or nonstick spray.
- Line the bottoms with parchment paper and grease the parchment paper as well.

Step 3: Measure and Sift Dry Ingredients
- Measure 1 3/4 cups flour, 2 cups sugar, 3/4 cup cocoa powder, 1 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1 1/2 tsp baking soda, and 1 tsp salt.
- Sift all dry ingredients together into a large mixing bowl to remove lumps and ensure even distribution.

Step 4: Combine Wet Ingredients
- In a separate bowl, whisk together 2 large eggs, 1 cup milk, 1/2 cup vegetable oil, and 2 tsp vanilla extract until well combined.

Step 5: Mix Dry and Wet Ingredients
- Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients.
- Use an electric mixer on medium speed to combine until smooth, about 2 minutes.

Step 6: Add Boiling Water
- Carefully add 1 cup of boiling water to the batter.
- Mix on low speed until fully incorporated. The batter will be thin.

Step 7: Pour Batter into Pans
- Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared cake pans.
- Tap the pans gently on the counter to remove air bubbles.

Step 8: Bake the Cake
- Place the pans in the preheated oven.
- Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

Step 9: Cool the Cake
- Remove the pans from the oven and let them cool on a cooling rack for 10 minutes.
- Run a knife around the edges to loosen the cakes.
- Invert the cakes onto the cooling rack, remove the parchment paper, and let them cool completely.

Step 10: Level the Cakes
- Once the cakes are completely cool, use a serrated knife to level the tops if they are domed.

Step 11: Prepare Frosting (Optional)
- If you want to frost the cake, prepare your favorite frosting (e.g., chocolate buttercream).
- Ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter (softened), 3 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 2 tsp vanilla extract, pinch of salt.
- Beat the butter until creamy, then gradually add powdered sugar and cocoa powder.
- Add heavy cream, vanilla extract, and salt, and beat until fluffy.

Step 12: Assemble the Cake
- Place one cake layer on a serving plate.
- Spread a layer of frosting on top.
- Place the second cake layer on top.
- Spread frosting over the top and sides of the cake using an offset spatula for smoothness.

Step 13: Decorate the Cake
- Decorate as desired with sprinkles, chocolate shavings, or fruit.

Step 14: Troubleshooting Tips
- If the cake sinks in the middle, it may be underbaked. Ensure the toothpick test is clean.
- If the cake is dry, reduce baking time slightly or check oven temperature accuracy.

Step 15: Serve and Enjoy
- Slice the cake with a sharp knife.
- Serve and enjoy your homemade chocolate cake!

Step 1: Gather Ingredients and Equipment
- Ingredients: 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, 2 cups granulated sugar, 3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 large eggs, 1 cup whole milk, 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 cup boiling water.
- Equipment: Measuring cups and spoons, mixing bowls, electric mixer (or whisk), spatula, 9-inch round baking pans, parchment paper, cooling rack, cake stand or serving plate.

Step 2: Preheat the Oven
- Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) to ensure it's at the right temperature when you’re ready to bake.

Step 3: Prepare the Baking Pans
- Line two 9-inch round baking pans with parchment paper. Grease and flour the sides and bottom of the pans to prevent sticking.

Step 4: Measure and Sift Dry Ingredients
- Measure 1 3/4 cups of all-purpose flour, 2 cups of granulated sugar, 3/4 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons of baking powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons of baking soda, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
- Sift these dry ingredients into a large mixing bowl to remove any lumps and ensure even distribution.

Step 5: Combine Wet Ingredients
- In another bowl, whisk together 2 large eggs, 1 cup of whole milk, 1/2 cup of vegetable oil, and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract until well combined.

Step 6: Mix Dry and Wet Ingredients
- Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing on medium speed with an electric mixer (or by hand) until well combined and smooth.

Step 7: Add Boiling Water
- Carefully add 1 cup of boiling water to the batter. Mix on low speed until the water is fully incorporated. The batter will be thin, which is normal.

Step 8: Pour Batter into Pans
- Evenly divide the batter between the two prepared baking pans.

Step 9: Bake the Cakes
- Place the pans in the preheated oven and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean.

Step 10: Cool the Cakes
- Remove the cakes from the oven and let them cool in the pans for 10 minutes. Then, transfer the cakes to a cooling rack to cool completely.

Step 11: Prepare Frosting (Optional)
- While the cakes are cooling, you can prepare a simple chocolate frosting. Beat together 1/2 cup of softened butter, 2/3 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder, 3 cups of powdered sugar, 1/3 cup of milk, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract until smooth and fluffy.

Step 12: Assemble and Frost the Cake
- Once the cakes are completely cool, place one layer on a cake stand or serving plate. Spread a layer of frosting on top. Place the second cake layer on top and spread frosting evenly over the top and sides of the cake.

Step 13: Decorate the Cake
- Decorate the cake as desired with sprinkles, fresh fruit, or chocolate shavings.

Step 14: Serve and Enjoy
- Slice the cake and serve. Enjoy your homemade chocolate cake!

Troubleshooting Tips:
- If the cake is too dry, try reducing the baking time slightly or adding a bit more milk to the batter.
- If the cake sinks in the middle, ensure your oven is fully preheated and avoid opening the door during baking.
- If the frosting is too thick, add a bit more milk, one tablespoon at a time. If it’s too thin, add more powdered sugar until the desired consistency is reached.

Step 1: Gather All Ingredients and Equipment
Step 2: Preheat the Oven
Step 3: Prepare the Cake Pans
Step 4: Sift Dry Ingredients
Step 5: Combine Wet Ingredients
Step 6: Mix Wet and Dry Ingredients
Step 7: Add Boiling Water
Step 8: Pour Batter into Pans
Step 9: Bake the Cakes
Step 10: Cool the Cakes
Step 11: Prepare the Frosting (Optional)
Step 12: Assemble and Decorate
Step 13: Troubleshooting Tips
Step 14: Serve and Enjoy

Step 1: Gather All Ingredients and Tools
- Ingredients: 1 and 3/4 cups (220g) all-purpose flour, 1 and 1/2 cups (300g) granulated sugar, 3/4 cup (75g) unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 and 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 and 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 large eggs, 1 cup (240ml) whole milk, 1/2 cup (120ml) vegetable oil, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 cup (240ml) boiling water.
- Tools: 2 round 9-inch cake pans, parchment paper, measuring cups and spoons, a large mixing bowl, a medium mixing bowl, a whisk, an electric mixer (optional), a cooling rack, a spatula, a cooling rack, a knife or cake leveler, and a piping bag with tips for decoration.

Step 2: Prepare the Baking Pans
- Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
- Grease the two 9-inch round cake pans with butter or non-stick spray.
- Cut out two circles of parchment paper to fit the bottoms of the pans and place them inside. Grease the parchment paper as well.

Step 3: Measure Dry Ingredients
- In a large mixing bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
- Use a whisk to ensure all dry ingredients are thoroughly combined.

Step 4: Measure Wet Ingredients
- In a medium mixing bowl, lightly beat the eggs.
- Add the milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract to the eggs and mix until combined.

Step 5: Combine Wet and Dry Ingredients
- Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients while mixing on low speed (if using an electric mixer) or by hand using a whisk.
- Once combined, slowly add the boiling water to the batter. The batter will be thin, but this is normal.

Step 6: Pour Batter into Pans
- Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared cake pans.
- Tap the pans gently on the counter to remove any air bubbles.

Step 7: Bake the Cakes
- Place the cake pans in the preheated oven on the middle rack.
- Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean.
- Rotate the pans halfway through the baking time to ensure even baking.

Step 8: Cool the Cakes
- Remove the cakes from the oven and let them cool in the pans for about 10 minutes.
- Run a knife around the edges to loosen the cakes, then invert them onto a cooling rack.
- Peel off the parchment paper and let the cakes cool completely.

Step 9: Level the Cakes (if necessary)
- Once the cakes are completely cool, use a knife or cake leveler to trim the tops of the cakes to make them even if they have domed.

Step 10: Prepare the Frosting (Optional: Chocolate Buttercream)
- Ingredients: 1 cup (230g) unsalted butter, softened, 3 and 1/2 cups (440g) powdered sugar, 1/2 cup (45g) unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 cup (120ml) heavy cream, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, a pinch of salt.
- In a large bowl, beat the softened butter until creamy.
- Gradually add the powdered sugar and cocoa powder, mixing on low speed until combined.
- Add the heavy cream, vanilla extract, and salt. Beat on high speed until the frosting is light and fluffy.

Step 11: Assemble the Cake
- Place one cake layer on a serving plate or cake stand.
- Spread a generous amount of frosting on top using a spatula.
- Place the second cake layer on top, flat side up.

Step 12: Frost the Cake
- Apply a thin layer of frosting around the entire cake to create a crumb coat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to set.
- Apply a thicker, final layer of frosting, smoothing it out with a spatula.

Step 13: Decorate the Cake
- Use a piping bag and tips to add decorative elements with the remaining frosting.
- Add any additional decorations such as chocolate shavings, sprinkles, or fruit as desired.

Step 14: Troubleshooting Tips
- If the cake is too dry: Ensure proper measuring of ingredients, and consider adding a bit more milk or oil next time.
- If the cake sinks in the middle: Check oven temperature accuracy and avoid over-mixing the batter.
- If the frosting is too thick: Add a small amount of cream or milk to reach the desired consistency.

Step 15: Serve and Enjoy
- Slice the cake with a sharp knife, wiping the blade clean between cuts for neat slices.
- Serve with a glass of milk or a cup of coffee, and enjoy your homemade chocolate cake!

Step 1: Gather Ingredients and Tools
- Ingredients: 1¾ cups (220g) all-purpose flour, 2 cups (400g) granulated sugar, ¾ cup (75g) unsweetened cocoa powder, 1½ teaspoons baking powder, 1½ teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 large eggs, 1 cup (240ml) whole milk, ½ cup (120ml) vegetable oil, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 cup (240ml) boiling water.
- Tools: Measuring cups and spoons, mixing bowls, whisk, electric mixer, 9-inch round cake pans (2), parchment paper, cooling rack, spatula, oven.

Step 2: Preheat the Oven
- Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). This ensures the oven is at the correct temperature when you’re ready to bake.

Step 3: Prepare the Cake Pans
- Grease the bottom and sides of two 9-inch round cake pans with butter or non-stick spray.
- Line the bottom of each pan with parchment paper to prevent sticking.
- Lightly dust the pans with flour, tapping out any excess.

Step 4: Measure and Sift Dry Ingredients
- In a large mixing bowl, measure and sift together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Sifting helps to remove lumps and evenly distribute the ingredients.

Step 5: Combine Wet Ingredients
- In another bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract until well combined.

Step 6: Mix Dry and Wet Ingredients
- Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing on medium speed with an electric mixer until combined.
- Slowly add the boiling water to the batter, mixing continuously. The batter will be thin; this is normal.

Step 7: Pour Batter into Pans
- Evenly divide the batter between the two prepared cake pans.
- Gently tap the pans on the counter to remove any air bubbles.

Step 8: Bake the Cakes
- Place the pans in the preheated oven on the middle rack.
- Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean.

Step 9: Cool the Cakes
- Remove the cakes from the oven and let them cool in the pans for 10 minutes.
- Run a knife around the edges of the pans to loosen the cakes.
- Carefully invert the cakes onto a cooling rack, remove the parchment paper, and let them cool completely.

Step 10: Prepare Frosting (optional)
- While the cakes are cooling, prepare your favorite frosting. Common choices are chocolate buttercream or cream cheese frosting.
- For chocolate buttercream: Beat 1 cup (230g) unsalted butter until creamy. Gradually add 3½ cups (440g) powdered sugar, ½ cup (50g) unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, and ¼ cup (60ml) heavy cream. Beat until smooth and fluffy.

Step 11: Assemble and Frost the Cake
- Place one cake layer on a serving plate or cake stand.
- Spread a generous amount of frosting over the top of the first layer.
- Place the second cake layer on top, aligning it evenly.
- Frost the top and sides of the cake with the remaining frosting, using a spatula to create a smooth or decorative finish.

Step 12: Decorate (optional)
- Decorate the cake with your choice of toppings such as chocolate shavings, sprinkles, fresh berries, or edible flowers.

Step 13: Serve and Enjoy
- Slice the cake with a sharp knife, serve, and enjoy your homemade chocolate cake.

Troubleshooting Tips:
- If the cake is too dry, consider adding an extra egg or slightly more milk next time.
- If the cake sinks in the middle, it may be under-baked. Ensure the oven temperature is accurate and avoid opening the oven door during baking.
- If the frosting is too thick, add a small amount of milk or cream until the desired consistency is reached. If it’s too thin, add more powdered sugar.

- Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). This ensures the oven reaches the correct temperature by the time you are ready to bake the cake.

Step 3: Prepare the Cake Pans
- Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans or line them with parchment paper to prevent the cake from sticking.

Step 4: Sift Dry Ingredients
- In a large mixing bowl, sift together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. This helps to aerate the dry ingredients and remove any lumps.

Step 5: Combine Wet Ingredients
- In a separate bowl, whisk together the sugar, eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract until well combined.

Step 6: Mix Wet and Dry Ingredients
- Gradually add the wet mixture to the dry ingredients, mixing on low speed with an electric mixer or stirring by hand until just combined. Be careful not to overmix, as this can make the cake dense.

Step 7: Add Boiling Water
- Slowly add the boiling water to the batter, mixing on low speed or stirring gently until smooth. The batter will be thin, but this is normal.

Step 8: Pour Batter into Pans
- Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared cake pans. Use a spatula to scrape the bowl and ensure all batter is used.

Step 9: Bake the Cakes
- Place the pans in the preheated oven and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean.

Step 10: Cool the Cakes
- Remove the cakes from the oven and let them cool in the pans for about 10 minutes. Then, run a knife around the edges and carefully transfer the cakes to a cooling rack to cool completely.

Step 11: Prepare the Frosting (Optional)
- While the cakes are cooling, you can prepare a chocolate frosting or ganache if desired. Common ingredients include butter, powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and milk or heavy cream.

Step 12: Assemble and Decorate
- Once the cakes are completely cooled, place one cake layer on a serving plate. Spread a layer of frosting on top, then place the second cake layer on top of that. Frost the top and sides of the entire cake.
- Decorate as desired with sprinkles, chocolate shavings, or other decorations.

Step 13: Troubleshooting Tips
- If the cake is too dense, you may have overmixed the batter. Mix just until combined.
- If the cake is dry, check your oven temperature with an oven thermometer to ensure it is accurate.
- If the cake sticks to the pan, ensure you properly greased and floured the pans or used parchment paper.

Step 14: Serve and Enjoy
- Slice the cake and serve. Store any leftovers in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days or in the refrigerator for up to a week.

Step 5: Combine Wet Ingredients

Step 13: Troubleshooting Tips

Step 1: Gather All Ingredients and Tools
- Ingredients: 1 and 3/4 cups (220g) all-purpose flour, 1 and 1/2 cups (300g) granulated sugar, 3/4 cup (75g) unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 and 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 and 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 large eggs, 1 cup (240ml) whole milk, 1/2 cup (120ml) vegetable oil, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 cup (240ml) boiling water.
- Tools: 2 round 9-inch cake pans, parchment paper, measuring cups and spoons, a large mixing bowl, a medium mixing bowl, a whisk, an electric mixer (optional), a cooling rack, a spatula, a cooling rack, a knife or cake leveler, and a piping bag with tips for decoration.

Step 2: Prepare the Baking Pans
- Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
- Grease the two 9-inch round cake pans with butter or non-stick spray.
- Cut out two circles of parchment paper to fit the bottoms of the pans and place them inside. Grease the parchment paper as well.

Step 3: Measure Dry Ingredients
- In a large mixing bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
- Use a whisk to ensure all dry ingredients are thoroughly combined.

Step 4: Measure Wet Ingredients
- In a medium mixing bowl, lightly beat the eggs.
- Add the milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract to the eggs and mix until combined.

Step 5: Combine Wet and Dry Ingredients
- Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients while mixing on low speed (if using an electric mixer) or by hand using a whisk.
- Once combined, slowly add the boiling water to the batter. The batter will be thin, but this is normal.

Step 6: Pour Batter into Pans
- Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared cake pans.
- Tap the pans gently on the counter to remove any air bubbles.

Step 7: Bake the Cakes
- Place the cake pans in the preheated oven on the middle rack.
- Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean.
- Rotate the pans halfway through the baking time to ensure even baking.

Step 8: Cool the Cakes
- Remove the cakes from the oven and let them cool in the pans for about 10 minutes.
- Run a knife around the edges to loosen the cakes, then invert them onto a cooling rack.
- Peel off the parchment paper and let the cakes cool completely.

Step 9: Level the Cakes (if necessary)
- Once the cakes are completely cool, use a knife or cake leveler to trim the tops of the cakes to make them even if they have domed.

Step 10: Prepare the Frosting (Optional: Chocolate Buttercream)
- Ingredients: 1 cup (230g) unsalted butter, softened, 3 and 1/2 cups (440g) powdered sugar, 1/2 cup (45g) unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 cup (120ml) heavy cream, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, a pinch of salt.
- In a large bowl, beat the softened butter until creamy.
- Gradually add the powdered sugar and cocoa powder, mixing on low speed until combined.
- Add the heavy cream, vanilla extract, and salt. Beat on high speed until the frosting is light and fluffy.

Step 11: Assemble the Cake
- Place one cake layer on a serving plate or cake stand.
- Spread a generous amount of frosting on top using a spatula.
- Place the second cake layer on top, flat side up.

Step 12: Frost the Cake
- Apply a thin layer of frosting around the entire cake to create a crumb coat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to set.
- Apply a thicker, final layer of frosting, smoothing it out with a spatula.

Step 13: Decorate the Cake
- Use a piping bag and tips to add decorative elements with the remaining frosting.
- Add any additional decorations such as chocolate shavings, sprinkles, or fruit as desired.

Step 14: Troubleshooting Tips
- If the cake is too dry: Ensure proper measuring of ingredients, and consider adding a bit more milk or oil next time.
- If the cake sinks in the middle: Check oven temperature accuracy and avoid over-mixing the batter.
- If the frosting is too thick: Add a small amount of cream or milk to reach the desired consistency.

Step 15: Serve and Enjoy
- Slice the cake with a sharp knife, wiping the blade clean between cuts for neat slices.
- Serve with a glass of milk or a cup of coffee, and enjoy your homemade chocolate cake!

Step 1: Gather Ingredients and Tools
- Ingredients: 1¾ cups (220g) all-purpose flour, 2 cups (400g) granulated sugar, ¾ cup (75g) unsweetened cocoa powder, 1½ teaspoons baking powder, 1½ teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 large eggs, 1 cup (240ml) whole milk, ½ cup (120ml) vegetable oil, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 cup (240ml) boiling water.
- Tools: Measuring cups and spoons, mixing bowls, whisk, electric mixer, 9-inch round cake pans (2), parchment paper, cooling rack, spatula, oven.

Step 2: Preheat the Oven
- Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). This ensures the oven is at the correct temperature when you’re ready to bake.

Step 3: Prepare the Cake Pans
- Grease the bottom and sides of two 9-inch round cake pans with butter or non-stick spray.
- Line the bottom of each pan with parchment paper to prevent sticking.
- Lightly dust the pans with flour, tapping out any excess.

Step 4: Measure and Sift Dry Ingredients
- In a large mixing bowl, measure and sift together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Sifting helps to remove lumps and evenly distribute the ingredients.

Step 5: Combine Wet Ingredients
- In another bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract until well combined.

Step 6: Mix Dry and Wet Ingredients
- Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing on medium speed with an electric mixer until combined.
- Slowly add the boiling water to the batter, mixing continuously. The batter will be thin; this is normal.

Step 7: Pour Batter into Pans
- Evenly divide the batter between the two prepared cake pans.
- Gently tap the pans on the counter to remove any air bubbles.

Step 8: Bake the Cakes
- Place the pans in the preheated oven on the middle rack.
- Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean.

Step 9: Cool the Cakes
- Remove the cakes from the oven and let them cool in the pans for 10 minutes.
- Run a knife around the edges of the pans to loosen the cakes.
- Carefully invert the cakes onto a cooling rack, remove the parchment paper, and let them cool completely.

Step 10: Prepare Frosting (optional)
- While the cakes are cooling, prepare your favorite frosting. Common choices are chocolate buttercream or cream cheese frosting.
- For chocolate buttercream: Beat 1 cup (230g) unsalted butter until creamy. Gradually add 3½ cups (440g) powdered sugar, ½ cup (50g) unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, and ¼ cup (60ml) heavy cream. Beat until smooth and fluffy.

Step 11: Assemble and Frost the Cake
- Place one cake layer on a serving plate or cake stand.
- Spread a generous amount of frosting over the top of the first layer.
- Place the second cake layer on top, aligning it evenly.
- Frost the top and sides of the cake with the remaining frosting, using a spatula to create a smooth or decorative finish.

Step 12: Decorate (optional)
- Decorate the cake with your choice of toppings such as chocolate shavings, sprinkles, fresh berries, or edible flowers.

Step 13: Serve and Enjoy
- Slice the cake with a sharp knife, serve, and enjoy your homemade chocolate cake.

Troubleshooting Tips:
- If the cake is too dry, consider adding an extra egg or slightly more milk next time.
- If the cake sinks in the middle, it may be under-baked. Ensure the oven temperature is accurate and avoid opening the oven door during baking.
- If the frosting is too thick, add a small amount of milk or cream until the desired consistency is reached. If it’s too thin, add more powdered sugar.
